member.name: P:Timetable.PictureBoxButton.ImageList
member.summary: Gets/sets the list of images used to display for the three states: normal (up), depressed (down) and disabled (grayed)

member.name: M:Timetable.PictureBoxButton.OnCreateControl
member.summary: When the control is instantiated, load the images used by the various button states.

member.name: M:Timetable.PictureBoxButton.OnClick(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: When the control is clicked, display the image for "normal" (up) state.

member.name: M:Timetable.PictureBoxButton.OnMouseUp(System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: When a mouse button is released, display the image for the "normal" (up) state.

member.name: M:Timetable.PictureBoxButton.OnMouseDown(System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: When a mouse button is pressed on the control, display the image for the "depressed" (down) state.

member.name: M:Timetable.PictureBoxButton.OnEnabledChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: When the control is enabled or disabled, display the appropriate image for the enabled (normal) or disabled (gray) state.

member.name: M:Timetable.PictureBoxButton.SetImageList
member.summary: This method (called when the ImageList property is set) sets the appropriate image for the control based on its enabled state, and sizes itself to accommodate the dimensions of the image.

member.name: M:Timetable.PictureBoxButton.SetButtonImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the image to the state specified by the imageIndex parameter, which must be set to one of the three values for normal (0), depressed (1) or disabled (2).

member.name: T:Timetable.PictureBoxButton
member.summary: This control extends the standard PictureBox control into a clickable button supporting images for the "up-state", "down-state" and "disabled-state" of the button.
